title: DataFam Career Pathmakers Tableau User Group 12 Nov 2025
author: The DataFam Tableau User Groups
description: Join us for an inspiring panel discussion with Annabelle Rincon, renowned Tableau Visionary and Ambassador, as she shares insights from her remarkable journey in the field of data analytics. This event will delve into the importance of data enablement and how it shapes successful careers in today's data-driven world.

title: Team DataFam Tableau User Group 19 Nov 2025

Marcelo will walk through the features and demonstrate how you can save 90% of your dashboard development time.

This session also includes some Q&A and a sneak peek at features that are not yet in production.

title: Team DataFam Tableau User Group - 13 Nov 2025
author: The DataFam Tableau User Groups
description:
"Accessibility Matters: Universal Design Means Data for All" by Roshni Gohil

Build inclusive vizzes by applying accessibility best practices to your dashboard design. Explore principles of universal design, its impact, and key features to ensure better usability for all.

Learning objective 1: Understand the impact of design choices on the consumers‚Äô ability to see, understand, and use your dashboards.
Learning objective 2: Recognize accessibility features built into Tableau and how to ensure your dashboards maximize their usefulness.
Learning objective 3: Understand universal design (UD) and how UD concepts help you build vizzes that are better for all your data viz consumers.

Slide deck: https://static.rainfocus.com/plus/tc25/sess/1736504356759001OOfO/presentpdf/1614_AccessibilityMatters_04_15_1744516420557001HRJa.pdf

title: Team DataFam Tableau User Group 11 Nov 2025
author: The DataFam Tableau User Groups
description:
"From Data Chaos to Clarity: Architecting Scalable Marketing Attribution Dashboards in Tableau" by Raunak Kumar

Marketing data is massive‚Äîbillions of ad impressions, CRM touchpoints, and web events flow through disconnected systems every day. Without the right data architecture, Tableau dashboards quickly become slow, brittle, or impossible to maintain.

In this session, I‚Äôll share practical strategies to architect marketing attribution data for performance and scale using a modular, open-source stack (Fivetran + dbt + Snowflake). We‚Äôll discuss how to:
Design aggregate tables that balance query performance with analytical flexibility.

Precompute multi-touch attribution metrics (Markov, Shapley) for efficient Tableau visualization.

Implement parameter-driven dashboards that let users toggle attribution models or time windows without performance lag.

Leverage Tableau Prep and incremental data pipelines to keep dashboards fresh and consistent.

You‚Äôll leave with a blueprint for high-performance Tableau dashboards that handle terabyte-scale marketing data while remaining responsive, accurate, and executive-ready.

title: Team DataFam Tableau User Group 5 Nov 2025
author: The DataFam Tableau User Groups
description:
"TC25 Stay in the Workflow with Tableau and (Viz) Extensions" by Jeremy Knott

Workstream consolidation with the implementation of Tableau viz extensions as well as the inclusion of spatial parameters to track claims / policies from storms.

author: The DataFam Tableau User Groups
description:
"A Reflection on the Tableau Next Hackathon" by Ann Jackson

Demonstrating what I created for the Tableau Next Hackathon with heavy emphasis on the framework that I built and shared. Allow there to be hands-on discussion and tactical (technical) discussion of how Tableau Next works. Think: a critical eye from a HOF visionary on what it "agentic analytics" means.

https://annujackson.medium.com/ai-in-practice-building-an-analytics-hackathon-project-77acce50b59c

title: K12 Tableau User Group 19 Nov 2025
author: The DataFam Tableau User Groups
description:
Pull up to the warm glow of your computer and take the chill off November! Learn more about accessibility issues and solutions for your Tableau dashboards and meet a community member.

Kate Ory (Chico Unified School District, California) Shares her journey with Tableau in a K12 school district.

Roshni Gohil (Massachusetts Institute of Technology -MIT) Shares how to build inclusive vizzes by applying accessibility best practices to your dashboard design. She will explore principles of universal design, its impact, and key features to ensure better usability for all.

Doc Kevin Lee Elder (Louisiana Tech University - LTU) Shares how to build accessible dashboards from a color point of view.

title: Tableau Newbies User Group 13 Nov 2025
author: The DataFam Tableau User Groups
description:
Two expert-led Tableau sessions in one event:
Building Great Looking Dashboards
Klaus Schulte (Tableau Hall of Fame Visionary) and Jim Dehner (Tableau Ambassador) share essential design principles and techniques for creating clear, effective, and visually appealing dashboards.

Tableau Speed Tipping: 40 Tips in 40 Minutes
Tore Levinson (Tableau Visionary) and Nhung Le (The Information Lab) deliver rapid, practical tips to help you work faster and smarter in Tableau.

title: Team DataFam Tableau User Group 29 Oct 2025
author: The DataFam Tableau User Groups
description:
"How I used data visualisation to understand music" by Ludo Koelman

My journey of understanding music through the lens of data visualisation and mathematical patterns. I created my own version of a ‚Äúmusic script language‚Äù with data visualisation best practices in mind. During this journey I realised I was on the receiving end of "user adoption gone wrong", reflecting on the parallel to data visualisation projects

title: Team DataFam Tableau User Group 21 Oct 2025
author: The DataFam Tableau User Groups
description:
"Ready, Set, Build! Crafting Custom Dashboard Checklists" by Fraser Gallop

Fraser will share his proven approach to building tailored checklist methodologies that have driven success across dozens of client projects. From best practices to hands-on tips, his content has resonated with data analysts, business intelligence professionals, and dedicated Tableau users alike.

"Documenting Your Dashboard: The Why, How, and What" by Scott Eaton

The presentation explores the critical importance of comprehensive documentation in the development and maintenance of data dashboards. We will discuss the reasons why documentation is essential, how to document the components, and the key components that should be documented.

title: Canada Tableau User Group 8 Oct 2025
author: The DataFam Tableau User Groups
description:
Join us for ‚ÄúGet a First Look at Tableau Next ‚Äì Canada Edition,‚Äù an exclusive preview of Tableau‚Äôs next-generation analytics experience‚Äînow available on the Salesforce platform! Discover the latest innovations revolutionizing how organizations interact with data. In this session, Candi and Kirk will walk you through a hands-on demo‚Äîfrom connecting to data and building a semantic layer to creating trusted metrics and leveraging AI-powered insights.

Explore how Tableau Next simplifies the analytics workflow, empowers teams across your organization, and supports smarter, faster decision-making. Whether you're a data analyst, business leader, or IT decision-maker, this is your chance to see how Tableau is making data more accessible than ever.

title: Tableau Public Tableau User Group 16 Oct 2025
author: The DataFam Tableau User Groups

‚Ä¢ Ilija Stojiƒá ‚Äì shares his harrowing tale of becoming a 1st time Tableau Ambassador.

‚Ä¢ Lucia Stefanuto‚Äì will present her Halloween - Best Candy Ever Viz of the Day

Watch the October Tableau Public TUG to learn how to do really cool stuff in Tableau.

title: Advancement Tableau User Group 14 Oct 2025
author: The DataFam Tableau User Groups
description:
"From Activities to Outcomes: Measuring the Full Impact of Prospect Development Teams"
Prospect development plays a critical role in advancing fundraising success, yet much of its impact extends beyond what standard CRM reports capture. In this session, Prisca Zaccaria and Jose Osorno from the University of South Carolina will share how they use the Prospect Development Scorecard and Log to evaluate both the quantitative and qualitative contributions of prospect research and management. Together, these tools link CRM data and harder-to-measure activities to pipeline movement, gift results, and overall fundraising progress.

title: Video Games Tableau User Group 13 Oct 2025
author: The DataFam Tableau User Groups
description:
‚≠ê The power of data in publishing a video game by Emmanuel Rosier
We all know the importance of data in bringing a product into market, and video games is no different. With over 10 years of experience in this industry, Emmanuel will share about how the current market landscape is like, and what it looks like to have data drive launch insights ‚Äì from release timings, early access best practices to how attrition unfolds. 


‚≠êFrom Pixels to Patterns: Early Analytics Shaping Games by Celia Fryer
Step back into the early days of gaming and visual analytics, where dashboards weren‚Äôt just about numbers‚Äîthey changed the course of game design itself. We‚Äôll revisit some early gaming history and look at a couple Tableau dashboards that influenced key decisions were part of decisions for player experience, offering a glimpse at how data-driven insights became part of the creative process. 

 
‚≠ê Other than that, we have a few more items to chat about:
What's everyone playing and their favorite games? (Of course we had to sneak in some data collection right? üòâ)
- Cadence of the business
- Timeline of key industry events
- Quick overview of the metrics we measure
- How you can get started with #GamesNightViz

title: Austin Tableau User Group 9 Oct 2025
author: The DataFam Tableau User Groups
description:
Schedule of Events
3:30 PM: Welcome & Introductions

Just a quick welcome and introduction to get the TUG started before we jump into the good stuff.

3:45 PM: Community Spotlight, Cameron Brown

Learn about one of our community members, Cameron Brown, Account Executive, Tableau Software.

4:00 PM: Feature Presentation: All things AI in Tableau, Ojoswi Basu

Discover how AI and natural language are transforming the way we interact with data in Tableau. This session will showcase practical demos and insights into these powerful capabilities.

4:30 PM: TableauNext Beta Wrap-up, Celia Fryar

Get an inside look at TableauNext beta with a focus on semantic modeling, data governance, and opportunities to enable agentic analytics. This short wrap‚Äëup will highlight key insights shaping the next era of Tableau.
